value: Clock face with the signs of the zodiac

label: Description
value: The signs of the zodiac are displayed upon its outside band. Chronos is seated underneath raising the hour glass with his left hand and pointing at a ribbon. It contains four angular holes in which the exact date is intended to be visible. Shown here is "Mardi 19/18 Mars 1785."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an entrance wall to a music or dance hall

label: Description
value: Five bays with a door opening with curtains in the center flanked by framed panels with dancers over sofas. The overdoors show Arion at left and a maenad at right. The decoration of the ceiling cove refers to Music and Poetry. Homer, Apollo, and a poet are the subjects of the painting in the frieze.

label: Physical description
value: Ben and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design of a Cabinet in the Louis XVI Style

label: Description
value: This drawing depicts a cabinet in the Louis XVI style ornately decorated with gilt-bronze mounts. The center panel consists of an oval medallion featuring a relief of the young Bacchus holding a thyrsus; he is supported by a standing Maenad (Bacchante) while he rides astride the back of a young satyr. Garlands, laurel leaves, herms, brackets and cartouches symmetrically decorate the cabinet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, gold paint, gouache on tracing paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Tapestry: Bacchus and Ariadne

label: Description
value: Bacchus with his procession passing Ariadne, points to her. Framing of scrollwork with garlands of vine and fruit, herms, satyr children.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and yellow, rose water color, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Garden of Monsieur de Ste. James at Neuilly, France

label: Description
value: View of an enclosed green garden with high clipped hedges at either side above trellis walls before which stand herms in shallow niches.  A small fountain stands at center and an architectural facade composed of trellis work surmounted by groups of putti is behind. Figure groups at left and right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor and gouache, ruled black border in pen and ink on white laid paper.

label: Provenance
value: Ph. de Chennevières (Lugt 2072); L on Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Architectural Fantasy: Temple of Athena Interior

label: Description
value: Flights of stairs lead downwards to the transept from a hall at left and from the apse at right. The design of the center of the apse has been subjected to a correction. The statue of the goddess was originally intended larger than she was definitely sketched. Only the left side of the the apse shows a colonnade and a relief over it in the rear.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, gray wash and white gouache over pencil on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Paper handscreen painted with a scene of four children playing 'blind man's bluff' inside a Rococo cartouche. Mounted on a turned wood handle. Verso: purple flowers painted on a yellow ground.

label: Physical description
value: Painted paper leaf, turned wood handle

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Salon, with Statues of Apollo and Venus

label: Description
value: Two design options are presented for this gallery and second story with balustrade. On the left, a statue of Venus stands at the far end of the halway perpendicular to two windows. On the right, a classical military monument frames the far right bay and a statue of Apollo at the center. The second floor has a window in the shape of a half circle.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 56, for 124 francs); Leon Decloux; 1911; Acquired by Museum

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two putti suspend a trophy of arms from a bracket on top.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A niche in each bay contains a vase with flowers and topped by a medallion and garlands. Three alternative designs are suggested for the decoration of the frieze.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Project for Tapestry Dedicated to Farm Life

label: Description
value: Colonnade of Ionic order with garlands of flowers twisted and festooned between the fluted columns. Suspended in the intercolumniations are trophies of garden implements and other attributes of agricultural life. On the ground, behind the colonnade appear dogs, peacocks, fowl, a fox in a trap and geese. Border in ink frames scene.-Based on text by R. Berliner

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Acquired from the Collection of Léon Decloux after 1906

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A dancing girl with a garland shown over a table which is supported by a grotesque plant and from which two cornucopias rise. Festoons are suspended on top. Framing band with intertwined waved garlands.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A burning brazier rises from an urn, with two sirens as handles. A leaf arabesque connects with a seated female sphinx, right, from whose head springs a cornucopia.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and sepia ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The zodiac with the twins are at the center of the composition. In the right corner, Auora and a puti are seated on clouds with an overflowing urn.

value: Pen and Chinese ink, graphite on paper

Design for a Wall Monument or Fountain

label: Description
value: An oval painting, showing a half reclining girl and a putto, is supported by a mermaid. A merman blowing shell horn, at right. The lateral fiure3s are incompletely shown.

label: Physical description

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Six bays of equal size and the first filled with a door and an overdoor, both showing representations of a prelate. The five others with alternating large square-headed and smaller semicircular beaded windows. Cases with books stand under the windows. The wall panels show vertical rows of alternating square and circular panels formed by interlacing bands. The square panels depict battle scenes; the circular ones, animals.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Ceiling of the Church of the Gesù, Rome, Italy

label: Description
value: Sketch of the Church of the Gesù ceiling, painted by Giovanni Battista Gaulli (called "Il Baciccio"), showing the Triumph of the Nature of Jesus. The painted decoration is contained between four windows at either side.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and grey watercolor on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The main decoration consists of escutcheons. Those in the bottom row are empty, except for the central one, in which is written: "questo e la parte/din anzi." St. Jerome, a Pope, St. Francis, Bishops are represented over the seats. Upon the back corners are statues of St. Luke, at left, St. Mark, at right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: At the center of the frieze is a medalion with the three graces. To either of its sides putti are surrounded by symbols of abundence and sit atop medalions and chalices.

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Series of modlings about border; circular element in center with tent motif and arabesques in interveneing spaces for which alternative suggestions are made.

value: An oval medallion shows a shepherdess and a shepherd with a pipe, is suspended before an oval background.

value: Shaped like a pitcher without a handle, the vase risese behind four putti. A pyramid in the left distance.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, red crayon, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Incense burner shaped like an altar lamp supported by two boughs ending with foreparts of two eagles as handles. Rose festoons are suspended from these and a winged female mask. Friezes surround the shoulder and lower neck. The upper neck is fluted behind a ring with a laurel garland. A putto with tambourine sits on top of the cover. Ovoidal tray supported by knobs at the bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black, brown ink, black crayon, graphite on cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1911: acquired by Museum

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A panel with an elaborated marble fountain is flanked by two doors, halves of which are shown. The overdoors show griffons flanking urns.

label: Physical description
value: pen and ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for the Wall Decoration for Marie-Antoinette's Apartment at Fontainebleau Palace

label: Description
value: An elevation of a wall.  At the center, an arch rising from a dado, is flanked by two folding doors with decorative panels.  The arch is lined inside by a draped curtain.  A chandelier is suspended at the center of the arch.  A panel with a painting is placed above each door.  The scenes in the paintings show Prudence and Justice.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache on off-white paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Frontal elevation of a wrought-iron balcony supported on carved stone brackets. The central motif consists of a rosette within a studded circle, and vegetal arabesques at either side. At the ends, two vertical panels with similar motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite-ruled borders in pen and black ink on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Church Wall Entrance

label: Description
value: Closed folding door flanked by two bays, each with three rows of stalls. The main door panels are decorated with trophies of relgious symbols and objects that attribute to martyrs, respectively. A trophy of arms lies in the overdoor. Within the shield is a coat of arms consisting of eight spokes ending with lilies.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The wall is divided into four panels and separated by pilasters. The panels on the right include trophies with religious attributes. Above two of the panels are lunettes. The left lunette contains musical instruments and the right lunette has religious implements.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, inkwash, graphite on paper

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

value: At the top, two crouching putti support the fruit garland. At the bottom, a lion crouches upon the top left corner of a door frame and faces a classical helmet on a stand.

value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on laid paper

Design for a Tureen and a Platter

label: Description
value: Tureen in elevation, platter in plan.  The left and right halves of the tureen body are slightly different, as alternative designs. Crowned escutcheon in center of body.  Various plants and crayfish form knop.

Design for Frame Surrounding the Portrait of Sir Francis Walsingham

label: Description
value: Design for frame surrounding the portrait of Sir Francis Walsingham. Two escutcheons, the top one blank and intended for the portrait, surrounded by a mortar board, seal, book, and bird at lower left. At bottom, the frame contains a figural scene depicting the presentation of a portrait painting to a seated woman.

Design for Frame Surrounding the Portrait of Sir Walter Raleigh

label: Description
value: Design for frame surrounding the portrait of Sir Walter Raleigh. A frame standing upon a concave dado before which a figure of a child or putto writes in a book, which he holds upon a globe. Framing lines and narrow paper margins.

Design for Frame Surrounding the Portrait of Edward Seymour, Duke of Somerset

label: Description
value: Design for frame surrounding the portrait of Edward Seymour, Duke of Somerset. Two escutcheons; the upper one blank and intended for the portrait. The lower escutcheon contains a figural scene depicting the ceremonial dubbing of Edward VI. Framing lines and narrow paper margins.

label: Description
value: In the center, within an arabesque of vine tendrils, Diana on a cloud, running. At either end, on stages supported by arabesques, Minerva, left, and Apollo, right, accompanied by other figures. At the bottom and top center, smoke emerges from urns atop altarpieces. Music-making figures disposed about the composition.

value: pen and ink, brush and watercolor on white paper
